chapter.title: OpenIDM Compatibility
chapter.para: This chapter covers major and minor changes to existing functionality, as well as deprecated and removed functionality in this release of OpenIDM. You must read this chapter before commencing a migration from a previous OpenIDM release.

section.title: Major Changes to Existing Functionality
section.para: The following changes will have an impact on existing deployments. Read these changes carefully and adjust existing scripts and clients accordingly.

listitem.para: OpenIDM ${docTargetVersion} replaces the existing audit facility with a new facility that is common across ForgeRock's Identity Platform. This change has the following effect on the JDBC schema of existing OpenIDM deployments:
A new auditauthentication table for the authentication log. This table has the following explicit mapping:
Changes to the object to column mapping for the auditaccess, auditactivity, auditrecon, and auditsync tables. For details of the changes, see the repo.jdbc.json file for your repository type.

section.title: Minor Changes to Existing Functionality
section.para: The following changes should not have an impact on existing deployment configurations.

varlistentry.term: Removal of predefined queries for audits

listitem.para: As the functionality exists with queryFilter, the following pre-defined queries have been removed from the default configuration: audit-last-recon-for-mapping, audit-by-recon-id-situations-latest, and audit-by-recon-id-situations-latest-filtered.

A new column, linkQualifier, has been added to the links table. This column enables correlation between a single source object and multiple target objects. Predefined queries on the links table have been adjusted accordingly.
The reconciliation and synchronization logs now include an additional linkQualifier field, which is used in the context of mapping a single source object to multiple target objects.

section.title: Functionality That Will Change in the Future
section.para: The Active Directory (AD) .NET Connector will be deprecated in a future OpenICF release, and, ultimately, support for its use with OpenIDM will be discontinued.

For simple Active Directory (and Active Directory LDS) deployments, the Generic LDAP Connector works better than the Active Directory connector, in most circumstances. For more complex Active Directory deployments, use the Powershell Connector Toolkit.
